description: Anger over Gaza is fueling support for independent candidates in the July 4 UK election. One poll shows British Muslim support for the UK Labour Party has halved since 2019.
title: Anger over the Gaza war fuels independent candidates in U.K. election

description: NPR's Ari Shapiro talks with ESPN soccer writer Luis Miguel Echegaray about the Copa America tournament and the U.S. men's team performances.
title: What to watch for in tonight's Copa America 2024 men’s soccer game

description: Feeling groggy these days? NPR's Life Kit has science-based strategies to help you sleep better, deeper and longer.
title: How to get better sleep

description: Constitutional law expert Kim Wehle discusses what the Supreme Court's immunity decision means for former President Donald Trump's legal cases.
title: Legal expert reacts to today’s Supreme Court ruling on presidential immunity

description: In Georgia, the Morehouse School of Medicine is training rural community doulas who will help pregnant women in the southwest part of the state, where maternal mortality rates are high.
title: A Georgia school trains doulas for rural areas that are losing maternity care

description: Many in the path of Hurricane Beryl prepare for the worst as the strongest storm on record this early in the season hits the Caribbean.
title: Hurricane Beryl, the strongest on record this early in the season, hits the Caribbean

description: The Supreme Court wrapped up its term Monday with a monumental ruling that grants former President Donald Trump substantial immunity from criminal prosecution.
title: Supreme Court ends term with monumental Trump immunity ruling

description: Voters in 76 countries are going to the polls this year – including the five largest democracies. And this surge of voting comes as democracy has been in decline.
title: The world's most interesting elections of 2024 and what’s to come

description: From abortion restrictions in Kansas to the removal of so-called junk fees in California, here are some laws taking effect today in states.
title: July 1 laws taking effect in states across the country

description: The stingray became a sensation earlier this year, in a purported case of asexual reproduction. She died weeks after her aquarium owners said she was not pregnant.
title: Charlotte the stingray, the would-be mom, has died at her N.C. aquarium

description: The U.S. Supreme Court on Monday has put Florida and Texas social media laws on hold, sending both cases back to lower cases for more review.
title: Supreme Court puts Florida and Texas Social Media Laws on hold

description: A trio of rider-less horses charged through central London, causing panic but no injuries before being returned to their barracks. A similar ordeal happened in April, though involved different horses.
title: Military horses ran loose through the streets of London once again

description: Carlo Acutis, who died at 15 in 2006, has long been called the "patron saint of the internet." After many years, two miracles and Vatican approval, he's officially set to be canonized, likely in 2025.
title: A teen tech whiz nicknamed 'God's influencer' will become the first millennial saint

description: Power of the Dream takes viewers behind the scenes to show how WNBA players took a stand during racial justice protests in 2020, helped elect a senator and negotiated historic pay raises.
title: The WNBA is having a moment. A new documentary highlights off-court player activism

description: The U.S. Supreme Court, in a 6-3 decision, ruled that a former president has absolute immunity for his core constitutional powers — and is entitled to a presumption of immunity for his official acts.
title: What the Supreme Court ruling on presidential immunity means for Trump

description: President Biden spent the weekend doing a lot of damage control following Thursday’s shaky debate. Simone Biles to lead U.S. Olympic gymnastics team.
title: Biden does post-debate damage control, and Simone Biles heads to her 3rd Olympics

description: The National Rally holds a strong lead in France's first round of legislative elections, polling agencies projected -- bringing the party closer to being able to form a government in round two.
title: The Far right wins the first round of France’s snap election

description: NPR's Michel Martin talks to former Democratic National Committee chair Howard Dean about Democrats' response to President Biden's debate performance, and whether Biden should drop out of the race.
title: 'I would tell Biden to hang in there,' former DNC Chairman Howard Dean says

description: As extreme heat grips the nation, doctors and researchers hoping to understand the heat's real-time risks are tuning into a relatively new tool from CDC: the Heat & Health tracker.
title: CDC's Heat & Health tracker collects ER data across the country in near real time

description: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with author and U.K. Labour Party candidate Yuan Yang about what women face in her former home country of China.
title: U.K. Labour Party candidate, born in China, writes about women's private evolutions

description: The number of resignations among Biden administration officials and American military service members over U.S. policy in Gaza is small, but growing.
title: 2 U.S. military members discuss why they resigned over the war in Gaza

description: As Fourth of July festivities roll out across the nation this week, the celebrations hold special meaning for newly minted citizens.
title: New U.S. citizens explain what it means to be American

description: The gymnastics team that will represent Team USA at next month's Summer Olympics in Paris is set. Nearly 40 gymnasts competed over the weekend in Minneapolis.
title: The gymnasts who will represent the U.S. at the Olympics have been chosen

description: There is no more state funding for the arts in Florida after Governor Ron DeSantis cut 32 million from the state budget. Now arts organizations are scrambling to make ends meet.
title: Hundreds of Florida arts groups scramble for funding after DeSantis vetoes grants

description: NPR's Michel Martin talks to legal affairs journalist David Kaplan about the Supreme Court's reversal of a longtime precedent giving government agencies leeway to interpret federal regulations.
title: What does a Supreme Court reversal mean for clean water and car safety?

description: That's a wrap on the U.S. Track and Field Trials, where it was make or break to get to the Paris games. Meet some of the sprinters, distance runners and shot-putters who will compete in France.
title: Highlights and heartbreak at the U.S. Olympics track trials

description: President Biden’s debate performance casts doubt on reelection chances. French voters push far-right party to strong lead in election's first round. Gymnast Simone Biles will head to another Olympics.
title: Morning news brief

description: Ross Cooper, 33, got into trading Pokémon cards in 2018, but he's less interested in making money than he is in building the community. He finds joy in simply giving the cards away, mostly to kids.
title: 'Gotta gift 'em all.’ A Pokémon YouTuber tries to grow the community through kindness

description: Torn between a base that wants more restrictions on abortion and a moderate majority that does not, it seems many Republicans would rather avoid the topic. But they can’t escape talking about it.
title: Republican candidates are downplaying abortion, but it keeps coming up

description: With the colonists in Jamestown, Va., the honeybees began a long history of supporting agriculture -- something that’s now recognized in a dozen states.
title: The European honey bee is now Virginia's official state pollinator

description: Did the Biden team assuage concerns about the president’s candidacy after Thursday’s debate? Also, a memo indicates the Trump campaign plans a “streamlined” platform ahead of the GOP convention.
title: The state of the Biden-Trump campaigns after last week's presidential debate

description: Whether the coup attempt was real or not, some Bolivians say they no longer believe what their leader says, and he'd be better served addressing the gasping economy and less time on political stunts.
title: Economic turmoil in Bolivia fuels distrust in government and its 'failed coup' claim

description: Researchers following a group of American children for decades found that even short periods of housing instability increased the chances of poor mental and physical health years later.
title: When little kids don’t have stable housing, it can affect their health later

description: For the 27-year-old gymnast, who has already won seven Olympic medals, the Games in 2024 are the next stop on her remarkable return to dominance after a two-year hiatus to tend to her mental health.
title: Transcendent once again, Simone Biles will lead U.S. Olympic gymnastics team in Paris
